channel.title: Question about a party
channel.description: I was wondering if I could be charged for anything (get in trouble in any form) if I went to an underage drinking party, but did not consume any alcohol myself. Basically, I would just go to the party and not drink. Would I be able to get in any trouble for just being there?

item.title: Question about a party
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:65, topic:533774”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=652568.msg4379627#msg4379627 date=1383126227]

[quote author=Wintercanon link=topic=652568.msg4379603#msg4379603 date=1383115231]

[quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=652568.msg4379570#msg4379570 date=1383103007]

It’s very different in Brisbane, I can tell you that. I lived there for 5 months last year.

Our local uni has an event at it’s bar maybe once a month… but other than that it’s mostly local nightclubs individually.

ps what college do you attend?
[/quote]Emmanuel. I’ve been here almost 2 years now. I’ve probably seen you around campus haha.

Ah. Nah I attended UQ while I was in Brisbane
[/quote]Emmanuel is a residential college at UQ.

Can’t say I knew that, hah.
[/quote]Yeah dude, you can’t live at UQ. You have to live at one of its associated residential colleges. The co-ed colleges are: Cromwell, Emmanuel, International House, St John’s and Union. Then there are men’s only colleges: King’s and St Leo’s. There are also women’s only colleagues: Duchesne, Grace and Women’s. By the way the Red Room is pretty sad as far as uni bars go.[/quote]
Yeah I didn’t live there. I was living off-campus and most of my work was collaborated through Blackboard. I still went too Red Room occasionally, you’re probably right we may of seen one another at one point, hah

Read full topic

item.title: Question about a party
item.dc:creator: @sinisoul sini
item.description:
@sinisoul wrote:

[quote=“Yz85Racer, post:54, topic:533774”][quote author=sinisoul link=topic=652568.msg4379306#msg4379306 date=1383043413]

I was wondering if I could be charged for anything (get in trouble in any form) if I went to an underage drinking party, but did not consume any alcohol myself. Basically, I would just go to the party and not drink. Would I be able to get in any trouble for just being there?
[/quote]Just plan on getting an underaged girl drunk and hook up? LoL

I thought that was Yz’s plan.

rocked up to a grade 10 highschool party and I’m almost 20… umad?

I party with people my age 1-2 times a week? Fuck me right? Love you Yz, just can’t understand why you’d do that and not get some sweet college pootang.

Haha I’m actually joking, I don’t always go to underage parties. It’s really not that creepy like I make it out too be, but it’s different here in Australia, mostly I’m just joking.

Here our culture kind of has a age group, half of the ones from about 16-21 usually all party together at the local house party, and the other half goes into “town” (you guys refer to it as ‘clubbing’ I believe). 99% of people around my age usually do one or the other, but I personally prefer going to house parties over clubbing. It’s also very different because there’s no ‘college’ parties here, our ‘college’ party is cheap vodka drinks at a night club on “Uni night” (every Wednesday night), that’s about as far as it goes for ‘college’ parties.

Also, underage is anyone under 16 in Aus, so it’s not necessarily ‘underage’ partying.[/quote]

Gotcha. I learned something today.

Read full topic

item.title: Question about a party
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Wintercanon, post:55, topic:533774”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=652568.msg4379502#msg4379502 date=1383090851]
Haha I’m actually joking, I don’t always go to underage parties. It’s really not that creepy like I make it out too be, but it’s different here in Australia, mostly I’m just joking.

Here our culture kind of has a age group, half of the ones from about 16-21 usually all party together at the local house party, and the other half goes into “town” (you guys refer to it as ‘clubbing’ I believe). 99% of people around my age usually do one or the other, but I personally prefer going to house parties over clubbing. It’s also very different because there’s no ‘college’ parties here, our ‘college’ party is cheap vodka drinks at a night club on “Uni night” (every Wednesday night), that’s about as far as it goes for ‘college’ parties.

Also, underage is anyone under 16 in Aus, so it’s not necessarily ‘underage’ partying.
[/quote]I live at college in Brisbane and it’s quite different than you describe. All the colleges at UQ throw a heap of events each week, minimum of like three. Some of those are exchanges to nightclubs, but a lot are parties at each other’s residential colleges.[/quote]
It’s very different in Brisbane, I can tell you that. I lived there for 5 months last year.

Our local uni has an event at it’s bar maybe once a month… but other than that it’s mostly local nightclubs individually.

ps what college do you attend?

Read full topic

Here our culture kind of has a age group, half of the ones from about 16-21 usually all party together at the local house party, and the other half goes into “town” (you guys refer to it as ‘clubbing’ I believe). 99% of people around my age usually do one or the other, but I personally prefer going to house parties over clubbing. It’s also very different because there’s no ‘college’ parties here, our ‘college’ party is cheap vodka drinks at a night club on “Uni night” (every Wednesday night), that’s about as far as it goes for ‘college’ parties.

Also, underage is anyone under 16 in Aus, so it’s not necessarily ‘underage’ partying.[/quote]I live at college in Brisbane and it’s quite different than you describe. All the colleges at UQ throw a heap of events each week, minimum of like three. Some of those are exchanges to nightclubs, but a lot are parties at each other’s residential colleges.

item.title: Question about a party
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“sinisoul, post:53, topic:533774”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=652568.msg4379303#msg4379303 date=1383042230]

I was wondering if I could be charged for anything (get in trouble in any form) if I went to an underage drinking party, but did not consume any alcohol myself. Basically, I would just go to the party and not drink. Would I be able to get in any trouble for just being there?
[/quote]Just plan on getting an underaged girl drunk and hook up? LoL

I thought that was Yz’s plan.

rocked up to a grade 10 highschool party and I’m almost 20… umad?

I party with people my age 1-2 times a week? Fuck me right? Love you Yz, just can’t understand why you’d do that and not get some sweet college pootang.[/quote]
Haha I’m actually joking, I don’t always go to underage parties. It’s really not that creepy like I make it out too be, but it’s different here in Australia, mostly I’m just joking.

Here our culture kind of has a age group, half of the ones from about 16-21 usually all party together at the local house party, and the other half goes into “town” (you guys refer to it as ‘clubbing’ I believe). 99% of people around my age usually do one or the other, but I personally prefer going to house parties over clubbing. It’s also very different because there’s no ‘college’ parties here, our ‘college’ party is cheap vodka drinks at a night club on “Uni night” (every Wednesday night), that’s about as far as it goes for ‘college’ parties.

Also, underage is anyone under 16 in Aus, so it’s not necessarily ‘underage’ partying.

item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

Just do it, if the party has a decent amount of people the police aren’t going to waste their time pinpointing every person that was there. They are going to be concerned about the potential drunk driving. Go get fucked up, enjoy yourself.
